snippet: In the governor’s race, voters chose a former health minister focused on local concerns over a former prime minister who campaigned on putting an end to atomically generated electricity.
abstract: Tokyo voters elect former television commentator and health minister Yoichi Masuzoe as governor, rejecting Morihiro Hosokawa, retired prime minister whose campaign focused on future of nuclear energy in Japan; Masuzoe's campaign centered instead on concerns local to Tokyo.
lead_paragraph: In the governor’s race, voters chose a former health minister focused on local concerns over a former prime minister who campaigned on putting an end to atomically generated electricity.

headline.main: Tokyo Rejects Candidate Who Stressed Nuclear Halt
headline.print_headline: Tokyo Rejects Candidate Who Stressed Nuclear Halt
